intro: Anaphalis margaritacea subsp. morrisonicola, commonly known as the Morrison's pussytoes, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, clustered white flowers that resemble tiny puffballs. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and meadows. Its inflorescence consists of numerous tiny flowers arranged in a compact, spherical shape. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
